Posted By: SuperSphinx (1/22/2011 11:08:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The last years worth of play has shown that this Baneslayer fits exactly where she needs to in the meta-game. I've played white for 15 years almost exclusively, and I feel very strongly that she balances out white very well in comparison to what the other colors have ramped up to. Serra Angel just doesn't pack the same punch that she did in years past.  
  
Keep in mind that virtually every other color has an easy answer to Baneslayer. And if by some chance you allowed your opponent to play her by turn 3 or 4 then, frankly, you deserve to feel the pain.
posts.html:

Serra Angel just doesn't pack the same punch that she did in years past.

Keep in mind that virtually every other color has an easy answer to Baneslayer. And if by some chance you allowed your opponent to play her by turn 3 or 4 then, frankly, you deserve to feel the pain.

Posted By: tazman321 (7/24/2011 2:38:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I must admit, I have a deck with just one copy of her in it and if I get her out she has a tendency to upset my opponent. The first strike lifelink can gain you back any life loss while making her a hassle to kill via blocking and I have actually seen her upset a dragon player with her unique protection making her a nice blocker and an unblockable attacker. Sure, she's over-hyped somewhat because she is still weak to removal and high damage. But she doesn't deserve overly-critical treatment just because a few people are overly-enthusiastic about her.

Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (8/25/2011 10:40:25 PM)
Rating:

This thin is scary. I mean, it's really powerful. I think that what really does it is that there is nothing comparable at the same CMC. I mean, if there were a 5/5 angel for 5, this would be okay, but this has first strike. I mean, just one hit on a player is enough to swing the game a lot--10 point life difference is very significant. I feel that this is a little overpowered, if only because any hit swings the owner 5 life at least. Plus, nothing short of straight kill spells/Dismember don't do anything to it. So yes, I don't think that power creep is as bad as many people say, but I do feel that mythics get an unnecessarily high power level
/rant

@HollinDayze69lolll: I don't have to patience to read that, you look like an idiot, it's unreadable, so please do us all a favor and shut up

posts.post_content:
This card isn't actually that great to be honest. There's a reason that this card has dropped so much in price, my local store sells these for $7 or $8, quite a difference from the old $50 price tag on it. Actually there's a few reasons. The original reason was [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) because he was bouncing these all day. The current reason is because its close enough in cost to be completing with the titans, which drop one turn later and actually affect the board in some way as they enter, they are also stronger than Baneslayer. EDIT: I also forgot to mention [Mirran Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirran Crusader) with [Sword of War and Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of War and Peace), which is usually better than this card in every single way, and is already swinging before this even hits the board.  
  
There's also the issue of removal. Face it, creatures for the most part suck. They are the second most vunerable card type (after auras) and as such are extremely easy/cheap to take care of. So in order for... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: DarthParallax (8/11/2011 6:53:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The problem with this card isn't that it's got extraordinary abilities, or that it's extremely powerful. The really idiotic thing is the mana cost. It's an average creature with a ridiculously reduced mana cost. THAT'S the problem.  
  
Sure, it dies to removal, like 80% of other creatures. Sure, it can be mind-controlled, like the vast majority of creatures. That's not the point. The point is that it's got +1/+1, protection from two very powerful creature types, first strike, AND lifelink over [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel)......... for exactly the same mana cost.  
  
Baneslayer's lack of vigilance is just a laughable attempt at making it not OBSCENELY stricly better than [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel). This card, along with anyone who willfully plays with it, is quite pathetic to need such an unfair advantage.
posts.html:
The problem with this card isn't that it's got extraordinary abilities, or that it's extremely powerful. The really idiotic thing is the mana cost. It's an average creature with a ridiculously reduced mana cost. THAT'S the problem.

Sure, it dies to removal, like 80% of other creatures. Sure, it can be mind-controlled, like the vast majority of creatures. That's not the point. The point is that it's got +1/+1, protection from two very powerful creature types, first strike, AND lifelink over Serra Angel......... for exactly the same mana cost.

Baneslayer's lack of vigilance is just a laughable attempt at making it not OBSCENELY stricly better than Serra Angel. This card, along with anyone who willfully plays with it, is quite pathetic to need such an unfair advantage.
